column2: ILLINOIS DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. A railroad crossbuck sign should be treated the same as a yield sign.
2. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 3. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
4. In Illinois motorists may NOT drive on a sidewalk except when it's part of a driveway.
5. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 6. Regulatory signs are:
7. Alcohol is the single greatest factor in fatal crashes.
8. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column6: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 9. What does this sign indicate?
10. This road sign means:
column8: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 11. When approaching a stop sign that is not marked by a crosswalk, drivers should stop their vehicles as close to the sign as possible.
12. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 13. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 14. To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
column4: The lane in the center of the road.
column6: The lane closest to the left curb.

column2: 15. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column6: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 16. Pedestrians ages 18 or older may skate on public roadways where the posted speed limit is 45 MPH or less from sunrise to sunset as long as traffic is not obstructed.
17. When approaching a stationary emergency vehicle using visual signals, Illinois law requires drivers to:
column4: change to a lane away from the emergency workers when possible.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 20. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 21. Drivers under age 19, are prohibited from any cellphone usage, including hands-free devices.
22. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 23. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 24. A driver may operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of cannabis prescribed for medicinal purposes.
25. In order to obtain court supervision for a traffic violation, a minor must appear in court with a parent/legal guardian and attend a traffic safety school.
26. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 27. Drinking coffee after drinking alcohol:
column6: Can multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column8: Has no effect on blood alcohol content.

column2: 28. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 29. Regulatory signs:
column4: provide information about the road rules and traffic laws.
column6: are diamond shaped and yellow or green.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column6: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column8: A left turn can be made only after stopping

column2: 31. In urban areas, drivers moving out of an alley, building, private road or driveway need not come to a complete stop before entering the roadway if the roadway is clear of traffic.
32. Vehicles must have at least one red or amber stop light visible for 500 feet from behind in normal sunlight.
33. This road sign means:
34. This road sign means:
column4: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 35. This road sign means:
